title: 1994년 Carter 사건

description:
## 사건 정보

**사건명**: STATE of Tennessee, Appellee, v. James L. CARTER, Appellant
**판결일**: 1994-07-13
**법원**: Court of Criminal Appeals of Tennessee
**관할**: Tennessee, TN

**판사**: Brown, Lynn, Scott, Summers

## 변호인

A C Wharton, Shelby Co. Public Defender and W. Mark Ward, Asst. Public Defender; and Loyee D. Lambert and Edward G. Thompson, Asst. Public Defenders, Memphis, for appellant., Charles W. Burson, Attorney General & Reporter, Joel W. Perry, Asst. Atty. Gen., Crim. Justice Div., Nashville, and John W. Pierotti, Dist. Atty. Gen., Phyllis B. Gardner and David B. Shapiro, Asst. Dist. Attys. Gen., Memphis, for appellee.

## 인용

- 890 S.W.2d 449

## 판결문 요약


890 S.W.2d 449 (1994)
STATE of Tennessee, Appellee,
v.
James L. CARTER, Appellant.
Court of Criminal Appeals of Tennessee, at Jackson.
July 13, 1994.
*450 A C Wharton, Shelby Co. Public Defender and W. Mark Ward, Asst. Public Defender; and Loyce D. Lambert and Edward G. Thompson, Asst. Public Defenders, Memphis, for appellant.
Charles W. Burson, Attorney General & Reporter, Joel W. Perry, Asst. Atty. Gen., Crim. Justice Div., Nashville, and John W. Pierotti, Dist. Atty. Gen., Phyllis B. Gardner and David B. Shapiro, Asst. Dist. Attys. Gen., Memphis, for appellee.
No Permission to Appeal Applied for to the Supreme Court.

OPINION
SUMMERS, Judge.
The appellant, James L. Carter, appeals from the judgment of the lower court holding that he can be retried for first-degree murder after the declaration of a mistrial. We granted the appellant's application for interlocutory appeal to determine whether a subsequent prosecution for the same charge is prohibited by the double jeopardy provisions of the state and federal constitutions.
We find that appellant can be retried. We modify the judgment of the lower court as to the use of aggravating circumstances should appellant be convicted and a death penalty phase ensue.
Appellant was indicted for first-degree murder. Prior to trial, problems arose concerning *451 the appellant's failure to provide notice of an alibi defense. There were several motions and counter motions in this regard. The record also reveals that on February 11, 19...
